alert.note: Alert for East Baton Rouge; East Feliciana; West Feliciana (Louisiana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 03 at 9:35PM CDT by NWS New Orleans
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southeastern West Feliciana, central East Feliciana and northwestern East Baton Rouge Parishes through 1030 PM CDT... At 935 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Slaughter, or near Jackson, moving south at 15 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Zachary, Jackson, Clinton, Slaughter, Wilson and Norwood. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.

area.areaDesc: East Baton Rouge; East Feliciana; West Feliciana
